Bonemonger Phalange.name: Bonemonger Phalange
Bonemonger Phalange.description:
Little is known about astral hermits thanks to their propensity to set up shop in hard-to-reach locations. They are far-travelling aberrations, each developing extremely specific obsessions such as light, words, or bones. Astral hermits study their area of interest in meticulous detail, using it as a medium through which to learn more of the world.

Corporeal Forms. A male astral hermit is made up of two bodies: his heart and his hearth. An astral hermit’s hearth is a maze-like construction at the centre of which is a portal to the Astral Plane. The astral hermit’s heart is how he presents himself to the world. Usually, this is in a form that is inviting to creatures of that plane, a tactic which ensures plentiful trade.

Reproduction. Male and female astral hermits lead two very different existences. A male astral hermit’s hearth is his bower, and his heart can never travel further than a few hundred feet from it. The abundance and richness of its treasures (which to the common person may appear as worthless relics) help to impress females of the species, which flit through the Astral Plane searching for portals into the hearth’s of other hermits. When a union is formed, eggs are produced and jettisoned into the astral expanse.

Crafters and Enchanters. Astral hermits are innately magical beings, able to imbue items or creatures with enchantments shaped by their subject of obsession. Unable to travel far from their hearths, astral hermits create reputations of skill with enchanting and use that as the currency with which they trade for relics that further fuel their obsession.

Bonemonger. The bonemonger’s obsession is bones. Fossilised, inscribed, splintered, or fresh, the bonemonger can read the history of every bone that passes him, learning much of the creatures to which they once belonged. The bonemonger has also learnt to animate these bones with his necromantic magic, allowing them to act as guards, workers, and scouts. The bonemonger chooses the form of a tiny white rabbit as his heart, an unassuming form that is nevertheless extremely deadly when threatened.

Go For The Throat.name: Go For The Throat
Go For The Throat.description: The bonemonger deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when it hits a target with a bite attack and has advantage on the attack roll.

Insightful Telepathy.name: Insightful Telepathy
Insightful Telepathy.description:
The bonemonger is constantly under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell (save DC 13). As a bonus action, it can probe deeper into the mind of any creature it can detect in its lair. If the creature fails its saving throw, the bonemonger has advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the start of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger uses insightful telepathy, make a Wisdom saving throw!

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the bonemonger fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.name: Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.description:
If the bonemonger would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 88 hit points, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bonemonger can now use the option in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional [[/award 1800xp]] (2,900 XP total) for defeating the bonemonger after its Osteomancer activates.

The bonemonger uses osteomancer.

Mythic Actions.name: Mythic Actions
Mythic Actions.description:
If the bonemonger’s Osetomancer trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the option below as a legendary action.

[[/item RsCFedyWEJ1wY6ab]]{Bonetide (Costs 2 Actions)}. A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 60-foot cone or 20-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The bonemonger makes one Bite attack and uses Mi.

Bonetide.name: Bonetide
Bonetide.description:
A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 60-foot cone or 20-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Foundry note: Default target is cone. Can be updated from the Target tab on the Save activity.

The bonemonger uses bonetide, make a Dexterity saving throw!

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The bonemonger on can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The bonemonger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

[[/item e92RzBmCljJLrbjs]]{Grasping Bones}. The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) slashing damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

[[/item hdQUdnX43lCuZwyl]]{Springstrike}. The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its Bite.

[[/item D2DgsqyRMC92eb6X]]{Animate Bones (Costs 2 Actions)}. The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a skeleton that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

The bonemonger attacks with his bite.

Grasping Bones.name: Grasping Bones
Grasping Bones.description:
The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a DC 13 Strength saving throw, taking 7 (2d6) slashing damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

The bonemonger uses grasping bones, make a Strength saving throw!

Mi.name: Mi
Mi.description:
The bonemonger proclaims “Mi. ” at one creature it can see that can hear it within 90 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 4 (1d8) thunder damage and 4 (1d8) psychic damage, and become &reference[frightened] of the bonemonger until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger proclaims "Mi", make a Constitution saving throw!

Springstrike.name: Springstrike
Springstrike.description:
The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its Bite.

The bonemonger uses springstrike.

Animate Bones.name: Animate Bones
Animate Bones.description:
The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

The bonemonger uses animate bones.

Trampling Charge.name: 践踏冲锋
Trampling Charge.description:
If the mammoth moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mammoth can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

If the mammoth moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw.

Gore.name: 顶撞
Gore.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage.

The Mammoth attacks with its Gore.

Stomp.name: 践踏
Stomp.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

The Mammoth attacks with its Stomp.

Hooves.name: 蹄击
Hooves.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

The Warhorse Skeleton attacks with its Hooves.

Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

The Ogre attacks with its Javelin.

Hide Armor.name: 兽皮甲
Hide Armor.description: 一种由厚毛皮制作的粗糙护甲。常见使用人群包括：野蛮人部落、邪恶类人生物以及其他缺少资源制作更好护甲的人。

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description:
If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes extra piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

Greataxe.name: 巨斧
Greataxe.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+6 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

The Minotaur Skeleton attacks with its Greataxe.

Gore.name: 顶撞

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
While the bonemonger lives, he can invoke the ambient magic of his lair to take lair actions on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties). The saving throw DCs and damage of the lair actions depend on the level at which the adventure is run, as shown in the Level-Based Lair Action Statistics table. The hunt’s level is determined by the average level of the adventuring party.

If a legendary creature has lair actions, it can use them to harness the ambient magic in its lair.

Bone Carapace.name: Bone Carapace
Bone Carapace.description:
Up to three creatures of the bonemonger’s choice that are in his lair become encased in articulating bone armour, gaining 2 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points are lost after 1 hour.

Bonemonger uses a lair action.

Probing Question.name: Probing Question
Probing Question.description:
The bonemonger asks one creature in his lair that can hear him an insightful and thought-provoking question. If the creature doesn’t answer the question truthfully and out loud within 6 seconds (the end of its next turn, if in combat), the creature is flung up to 20 ft. in a direction of the bonemonger’s choice. Examples of possible questions:

  • What is your greatest fear?

  • Who do you admire most and why?

  • Do you have any biases for or against certain people?

  • What is the biggest mistake you have ever made?

  • What item in your possession do you care most about and why?

  • How do you feel about keeping secrets from the rest of the party?

The bonemonger uses a lair action, answer the question!

Tanglebones.name: Tanglebones
Tanglebones.description:
Bones of all descriptions—spines, claws, and jaws—emerge from the floor, walls, and ceiling of the bonemonger’s lair. Until initiative count 20 on the following round, all surfaces in the lair become difficult terrain for creatures of the bonemonger’s choice. In addition, each creature of the bonemonger’s choice that is within 5 feet of a surface a surface when this lair action occurs must make a Strength saving throw or become &reference[grappled] by the bones (escape DC 12), which have a reach of 5 feet.

The bonemonger uses a lair action, make a Strength saving throw!

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Grey Knight makes five melee attacks.

Greatsword.name: 巨剑
Greatsword.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

The Grey Knight attacks with their Greatsword.

Heavy Crossbow.name: 重弩
Heavy Crossbow.description:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

The Grey Knight attacks with their Heavy Crossbow.

Leadership.name: 领导力
Leadership.description: For 1 minute, The Grey Knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if The Grey Knight is incapacitated.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
The Grey Knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, The Grey Knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The Grey Knight adds 2 to their AC against one melee Attack that would hit them.

Brave.name: 勇气
Brave.description: The Grey Knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

'Tis But a Scratch.name: 'Tis But a Scratch
'Tis But a Scratch.description: Each time The Grey Knight loses 20% of their hit points, they lose one limb. Bizarrely, this doesn’t affect their ability to continue moving or attacking.

Undead Fortitude.name: 不死坚韧
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces The Grey Knight to 0 hit points, they must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken. If the damage is radiant or from a critical hit, The Grey Knight automatically fails this saving throw. On a success, The Grey Knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

Dire Bunny.name: Dire Bunny
Dire Bunny.description:
Foundry Note: Assign the Dire Bunny's Challenge Rating (CR) to your Tamer level for the correct proficiency bonus.

Dire Bunny

Yes, a dire bunny is a great enchanting buddy, valuable rogue-like combatant, and excellent at getting the truth out of folks. But what no-one talks about is their ability to plough a field. One word and thousands of bony limbs dig it all up. Just don’t take them to a graveyard, they get… distracted.

Heliana, Aspiring Farmer

Type: Aberration

Creature Component: Bonemonger

Bonus Tamer Improvement: Sneak Attack

Astral hermits are a strange and esoteric species. Mercantile in nature, those that visit the Material Plane choose forms that appear innocuous and unthreatening, to better sell their enchanting services. The hermit from which this specimen, dubbed the ‘dire bunny’, has been crafted had a peculiar fascination with bones that has been surprisingly difficult to remove.

If any of the dire bunny’s traits or actions require saving throws, it is always against the dire bunny’s save DC, as calculated below.

Save DC = 8 + the tamer’s proficiency bonus + the dire bunny’s Constitution modifier

Bonemonger.name: Bonemonger
Bonemonger.description: Whenever the dire bunny first sees a bone, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or become distracted until it possesses the bone or the bone is no longer in its line of sight. While distracted, it spends its movement and actions trying to get closer to the bone and sequester it. A distracted dire bunny whose owner issues a command to it repeats the saving throw at the end of its next turn, ending the effect on a success and becoming immune to the allure of any bone for the next hour.

Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Detect Thoughts.name: 侦测思想
Detect Thoughts.description: The dire bunny learns the surface thoughts of one creature it can see within 30 feet of it for 1 minute. It can attempt to probe deeper into the creature’s mind, using an action to force the target to make a [[/save format=long]], per the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell.

The Fire Giant attacks with its Rock.

Bonemonger Femur.name: Bonemonger Femur
Bonemonger Femur.description:
Little is known about astral hermits thanks to their propensity to set up shop in hard-to-reach locations. They are far-travelling aberrations, each developing extremely specific obsessions such as light, words, or bones. Astral hermits study their area of interest in meticulous detail, using it as a medium through which to learn more of the world.

Corporeal Forms. A male astral hermit is made up of two bodies: his heart and his hearth. An astral hermit’s hearth is a maze-like construction at the centre of which is a portal to the Astral Plane. The astral hermit’s heart is how he presents himself to the world. Usually, this is in a form that is inviting to creatures of that plane, a tactic which ensures plentiful trade.

Reproduction. Male and female astral hermits lead two very different existences. A male astral hermit’s hearth is his bower, and his heart can never travel further than a few hundred feet from it. The abundance and richness of its treasures (which to the common person may appear as worthless relics) help to impress females of the species, which flit through the Astral Plane searching for portals into the hearth’s of other hermits. When a union is formed, eggs are produced and jettisoned into the astral expanse.

Crafters and Enchanters. Astral hermits are innately magical beings, able to imbue items or creatures with enchantments shaped by their subject of obsession. Unable to travel far from their hearths, astral hermits create reputations of skill with enchanting and use that as the currency with which they trade for relics that further fuel their obsession.

Bonemonger. The bonemonger’s obsession is bones. Fossilised, inscribed, splintered, or fresh, the bonemonger can read the history of every bone that passes him, learning much of the creatures to which they once belonged. The bonemonger has also learnt to animate these bones with his necromantic magic, allowing them to act as guards, workers, and scouts. The bonemonger chooses the form of a tiny white rabbit as his heart, an unassuming form that is nevertheless extremely deadly when threatened.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The bonemonger makes one @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.35L3vKd8Ii8mF2Ls]{Bite} attack and uses @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.8HWmqb6mYRtj5S1n]{Mi}.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the bonemonger fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The bonemonger on can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The bonemonger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Mythic Actions.description:
If the bonemonger’s Osetomancer trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the option below as a legendary action.

@UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.q1dP2ZN55zH3XsM3]{Bare the Throat}

@embed[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.q1dP2ZN55zH3XsM3 inline]{Bare the Throat}

Go For The Throat.name: Go For The Throat
Go For The Throat.description: The bonemonger deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage when it hits a target with a @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.35L3vKd8Ii8mF2Ls]{bite} attack and has &reference[advantage]{advantage} on the attack roll.

Bonetide.name: Bonetide
Bonetide.description: A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 90-foot cone or 30-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Bare the Throat.name: Bare the Throat
Bare the Throat.description: The bonemonger uses its @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.f98KeIYJU7wiTQ1E]{Grasping Bones} and @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.QwvWSiquSZMRLZHF]{Springstrike} legendary action options.

Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.name: Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.description: If the bonemonger would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 246 hit points, it gains 100 temporary hit points as bones coalesce around it, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bonemonger can now use the option in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional [[/award 41000xp]] (63,000 XP total) for defeating the bonemonger after its Osteomancer activates.

Insightful Telepathy.name: Insightful Telepathy
Insightful Telepathy.description: The bonemonger is constantly under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell (save DC 20). As a bonus action, it can probe deeper into the mind of any creature it can detect in its lair. If the creature fails its saving throw, the bonemonger has &reference[advantage]{advantage} on attack rolls against that creature until the start of the bonemonger’s next turn.

Animate Bones.name: Animate Bones
Animate Bones.description: The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

Springstrike.name: Springstrike
Springstrike.description: The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its @UUID[Actor.e3zHHxbX1he8NjR9.Item.35L3vKd8Ii8mF2Ls]{Bite}.

Grasping Bones.name: Grasping Bones
Grasping Bones.description: The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

Mi.name: Mi
Mi.description: The bonemonger proclaims “Mi. ” at one creature it can see that can hear it within 90 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]], and become &reference[frightened] of the bonemonger until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) piercing damage.

If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

The Tyrannosaurus Rex attacks with its Bite. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can't bite another target.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The tyrannosaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

Tail.name: 尾击
Tail.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

The Tyrannosaurus Rex attacks with its Tail.

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
While the bonemonger lives, he can invoke the ambient magic of his lair to take lair actions on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties). The saving throw DCs and damage of the lair actions depend on the level at which the adventure is run, as shown in the Level-Based Lair Action Statistics table. The hunt’s level is determined by the average level of the adventuring party.

If a legendary creature has lair actions, it can use them to harness the ambient magic in its lair.

Bone Carapace.name: Bone Carapace
Bone Carapace.description:
Up to three creatures of the bonemonger’s choice that are in his lair become encased in articulating bone armour, gaining 8 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points are lost after 1 hour.

Bonemonger uses a lair action.

Probing Question.name: Probing Question
Probing Question.description:
The bonemonger asks one creature in his lair that can hear him an insightful and thought-provoking question. If the creature doesn’t answer the question truthfully and out loud within 6 seconds (the end of its next turn, if in combat), the creature is flung up to 60 ft. in a direction of the bonemonger’s choice. Examples of possible questions:

  • What is your greatest fear?

  • Who do you admire most and why?

  • Do you have any biases for or against certain people?

  • What is the biggest mistake you have ever made?

  • What item in your possession do you care most about and why?

  • How do you feel about keeping secrets from the rest of the party?

The bonemonger uses a lair action, answer the question!

Tanglebones.name: Tanglebones
Tanglebones.description:
Bones of all descriptions—spines, claws, and jaws—emerge from the floor, walls, and ceiling of the bonemonger’s lair. Until initiative count 20 on the following round, all surfaces in the lair become difficult terrain for creatures of the bonemonger’s choice. In addition, each creature of the bonemonger’s choice that is within 5 feet of a surface a surface when this lair action occurs must make a Strength saving throw or become &reference[grappled] by the bones (escape DC 17), which have a reach of 5 feet.

The bonemonger uses a lair action, make a Strength saving throw!

The Skeleton attacks with its Shortbow.

Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Sunlight Sensitivity.name: 日照敏感
Sunlight Sensitivity.description: 处于阳光下时，[[lookup @name]]进行攻击检定，以及进行依赖视觉的感知（察觉）检定时具有劣势。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

Longbow.name: 长弓
Longbow.description:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

The Wight attacks with its Longbow.

Longsword.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

The Wight attacks with its Longsword.

Life Drain.name: 吸取生命
Life Drain.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

The target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

The Wight attacks with its Life Drain. The target must make a Constitution saving throw.

Each other creature in the area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The bonemonger on can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The bonemonger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach [[lookup @item.range.value]] ft. , one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Grasping Bones.name: Grasping Bones
Grasping Bones.description: The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

Mi.name: Mi
Mi.description: The bonemonger proclaims “Mi. ” at one creature it can see that can hear it within 90 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]], and become &reference[frightened] of the bonemonger until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn.

Springstrike.name: Springstrike
Springstrike.description: The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its @UUID[Actor.FpIWa9bt4m78q5RW.Item.xCmJfRMqKVvhAQHU]{Bite}.

Animate Bones.name: Animate Bones
Animate Bones.description: The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

Bonemonger Ulna (Osteomancer).name: Bonemonger Ulna (Osteomancer)
Bonemonger Ulna (Osteomancer).description:
Little is known about astral hermits thanks to their propensity to set up shop in hard-to-reach locations. They are far-travelling aberrations, each developing extremely specific obsessions such as light, words, or bones. Astral hermits study their area of interest in meticulous detail, using it as a medium through which to learn more of the world.

Corporeal Forms. A male astral hermit is made up of two bodies: his heart and his hearth. An astral hermit’s hearth is a maze-like construction at the centre of which is a portal to the Astral Plane. The astral hermit’s heart is how he presents himself to the world. Usually, this is in a form that is inviting to creatures of that plane, a tactic which ensures plentiful trade.

Reproduction. Male and female astral hermits lead two very different existences. A male astral hermit’s hearth is his bower, and his heart can never travel further than a few hundred feet from it. The abundance and richness of its treasures (which to the common person may appear as worthless relics) help to impress females of the species, which flit through the Astral Plane searching for portals into the hearth’s of other hermits. When a union is formed, eggs are produced and jettisoned into the astral expanse.

Crafters and Enchanters. Astral hermits are innately magical beings, able to imbue items or creatures with enchantments shaped by their subject of obsession. Unable to travel far from their hearths, astral hermits create reputations of skill with enchanting and use that as the currency with which they trade for relics that further fuel their obsession.

Bonemonger. The bonemonger’s obsession is bones. Fossilised, inscribed, splintered, or fresh, the bonemonger can read the history of every bone that passes him, learning much of the creatures to which they once belonged. The bonemonger has also learnt to animate these bones with his necromantic magic, allowing them to act as guards, workers, and scouts. The bonemonger chooses the form of a tiny white rabbit as his heart, an unassuming form that is nevertheless extremely deadly when threatened.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The bonemonger makes one Bite attack and uses Mi.

Bare the Throat.name: Bare the Throat
Bare the Throat.description: The bonemonger uses its Grasping Bones and Springstrike legendary action options.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the bonemonger fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The bonemonger on can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The bonemonger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

[[/item 3x7NGK19ULqj3ISy]]{Grasping Bones}. The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

[[/item qLZegjAKvwATmYBU]]{Springstrike}. The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its Bite.

[[/item jAf4W3yDwAmDn65U]]{Animate Bones (Costs 2 Actions)}. The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a skeleton that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

Mythic Actions.name: Mythic Actions
Mythic Actions.description:
If the bonemonger’s Osetomancer trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the option below as a legendary action.

[[/item 0S3VNE05bQwYEeyr]]{Bonetide (Costs 2 Actions)}. A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 60-foot cone or 20-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

[[/item 31tBBPbvelPfj6q7]]{Bare the Throat}. The bonemonger uses its Grasping Bones and Springstrike legendary action options.

Bonetide.name: Bonetide
Bonetide.description:
A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 60-foot cone or 20-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Foundry note: Default target is cone. Can be updated from the Target tab on the Save activity.

The bonemonger uses bonetide, make a Dexterity saving throw!

The bonemonger uses grasping bones, make a Strength saving throw!

Springstrike.name: Springstrike
Springstrike.description:
The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its Bite.

The bonemonger uses springstrike.

Animate Bones.name: Animate Bones
Animate Bones.description:
The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

The bonemonger uses animate bones.

Mi.name: Mi
Mi.description:
The bonemonger proclaims “Mi. ” at one creature it can see that can hear it within 90 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) thunder damage and 9 (2d8) psychic damage, and become &reference[frightened] of the bonemonger until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger proclaims "Mi", make a Constitution saving throw!

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. , one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

The bonemonger attacks with his bite.

Go For The Throat.name: Go For The Throat
Go For The Throat.description: The bonemonger deals an extra 7 ([[/r 3d6]]) damage when it hits a target with a bite attack and has advantage on the attack roll.

Insightful Telepathy.name: Insightful Telepathy
Insightful Telepathy.description:
The bonemonger is constantly under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell (save DC 17). As a bonus action, it can probe deeper into the mind of any creature it can detect in its lair. If the creature fails its saving throw, the bonemonger has advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the start of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger uses insightful telepathy, make a Wisdom saving throw!

Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.name: Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.description:
If the bonemonger would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 150 hit points, it gains 60 temporary hit points as bones coalesce around it, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bonemonger can now use the option in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional [[/award 13000xp]] (20,200 XP total) for defeating the bonemonger after its Osteomancer activates.

The bonemonger uses osteomancer.

The bonemonger proclaims "Mi", make a Constitution saving throw!

Lair Actions.name: Lair Actions
Lair Actions.description:
While the bonemonger lives, he can invoke the ambient magic of his lair to take lair actions on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties). The saving throw DCs and damage of the lair actions depend on the level at which the adventure is run, as shown in the Level-Based Lair Action Statistics table. The hunt’s level is determined by the average level of the adventuring party.

If a legendary creature has lair actions, it can use them to harness the ambient magic in its lair.

Bone Carapace.name: Bone Carapace
Bone Carapace.description:
Up to three creatures of the bonemonger’s choice that are in his lair become encased in articulating bone armour, gaining 5 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points are lost after 1 hour.

Bonemonger uses a lair action.

Probing Question.name: Probing Question
Probing Question.description:
The bonemonger asks one creature in his lair that can hear him an insightful and thought-provoking question. If the creature doesn’t answer the question truthfully and out loud within 6 seconds (the end of its next turn, if in combat), the creature is flung up to 40 ft. in a direction of the bonemonger’s choice. Examples of possible questions:

  • What is your greatest fear?

  • Who do you admire most and why?

  • Do you have any biases for or against certain people?

  • What is the biggest mistake you have ever made?

  • What item in your possession do you care most about and why?

  • How do you feel about keeping secrets from the rest of the party?

The bonemonger uses a lair action, answer the question!

Tanglebones.name: Tanglebones
Tanglebones.description:
Bones of all descriptions—spines, claws, and jaws—emerge from the floor, walls, and ceiling of the bonemonger’s lair. Until initiative count 20 on the following round, all surfaces in the lair become difficult terrain for creatures of the bonemonger’s choice. In addition, each creature of the bonemonger’s choice that is within 5 feet of a surface a surface when this lair action occurs must make a Strength saving throw or become &reference[grappled] by the bones (escape DC 15), which have a reach of 5 feet.

The bonemonger uses a lair action, make a Strength saving throw!

Fork.name: 叉击
Fork.description:
近战武器攻击：命中 +10，， 触及 10 尺， 单一目标。命中：15 （2d8 + 6） 点穿刺伤害。

角魔使用叉击发动攻击。

Devil's Sight.name: Devil's Sight
Devil's Sight.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's darkvision.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: 魔鬼对抗法术和其他魔法效应时进行的豁免检定具有优势。

Tail.name: 尾击
Tail.description:
近战武器攻击：命中 +10，， 触及 10 尺， 单一目标。命中：10 （1d8 + 6） 点穿刺伤害。

如果目标是一个生物（不死生物或构装生物除外），则其必须进行一次 DC 17 体质 豁免。豁免失败者将因该魔性伤口在每个其自己回合开始时失去 10 （3d6） 点生命值。该魔鬼每次以本攻击命中带着该伤口的生物时，伤口造成的伤害就提高 10 （3d6）。任何生物都可以用一个动作进行一次 DC 12 感知（医药）检定以为伤口止血。目标接受魔法治疗时也可以使该伤口愈合。

角魔使用其尾击发动攻击。若目标为非亡灵、构装生物，目标必须进行一次体质豁免检定。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: 角魔发动三次攻击：两次叉刺，一次尾击。它可以用投掷烈焰取代任一次近战攻击。

Hurl Flame.name: 投掷烈焰
Hurl Flame.description:
远程法术攻击：命中 +7，， 射程 150 尺， 单一目标。命中：14 （4d6） 火焰伤害。

火焰将点燃所有未被着装或携带的可燃物件。

角魔使用投掷烈焰发动攻击。火焰将点燃所有未被着装或携带的可燃物件。

Each other creature in the area must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Foundry note: Default target is cone. Can be updated from the Target tab on the Save activity.

The bonemonger uses bonetide, make a Dexterity saving throw!

Bare the Throat.name: Bare the Throat
Bare the Throat.description: The bonemonger uses its Grasping Bones and Springstrike legendary action options.

Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.name: Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.description:
If the bonemonger would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 246 hit points, it gains 100 temporary hit points as bones coalesce around it, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bonemonger can now use the option in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional [[/award 41000xp]] (63,000 XP total) for defeating the bonemonger after its Osteomancer activates.

The bonemonger uses osteomancer.

Insightful Telepathy.name: Insightful Telepathy
Insightful Telepathy.description:
The bonemonger is constantly under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell (save DC 20). As a bonus action, it can probe deeper into the mind of any creature it can detect in its lair. If the creature fails its saving throw, the bonemonger has advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the start of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger uses insightful telepathy, make a Wisdom saving throw!

Animate Bones.name: Animate Bones
Animate Bones.description:
The bonemonger animates bones it can see with 90 feet of it, creating a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.nU8GN8La8DCt8SDb]{skeleton} that follows the bonemonger’s telepathic commands.

The bonemonger uses animate bones.

Springstrike.name: Springstrike
Springstrike.description:
The bonemonger moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and then makes one attack with its Bite.

The bonemonger uses springstrike.

Grasping Bones.name: Grasping Bones
Grasping Bones.description:
The bonemonger targets a surface within 60 feet of it, causing a skeletal limb to burst out and grasp at a creature within 5 feet of the surface. The creature must make a DC 20 Strength saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) slashing damage and becoming &reference[restrained] until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being restrained on a success.

The bonemonger uses grasping bones, make a Strength saving throw!

Mi.name: Mi
Mi.description:
The bonemonger proclaims “Mi. ” at one creature it can see that can hear it within 90 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 13 (3d8) thunder damage and 13 (3d8) psychic damage, and become &reference[frightened] of the bonemonger until the end of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger proclaims "Mi", make a Constitution saving throw!

Plate Armor.name: 板甲
Plate Armor.description: 板甲由覆盖全身，且相互连接的模铸金属板组成。一套板甲包括护手、重皮靴、一顶附面甲的头盔以及在护甲底层的厚重的布甲。其锁扣和皮带结构可以将护甲重量分配到身体各处。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Grey Knight makes four melee attacks.

Greatsword.name: 巨剑
Greatsword.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

The Grey Knight attacks with their Greatsword.

Heavy Crossbow.name: 重弩
Heavy Crossbow.description:
Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

The Grey Knight attacks with their Heavy Crossbow.

Leadership.name: 领导力
Leadership.description: For 1 minute, The Grey Knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 ft. of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if The Grey Knight is incapacitated.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description:
The Grey Knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, The Grey Knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The Grey Knight adds 2 to their AC against one melee Attack that would hit them.

Brave.name: 勇气
Brave.description: The Grey Knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

'Tis But a Scratch.name: 'Tis But a Scratch
'Tis But a Scratch.description: Each time The Grey Knight loses 20% of their hit points, they lose one limb. Bizarrely, this doesn’t affect their ability to continue moving or attacking.

Undead Fortitude.name: 不死坚韧
Undead Fortitude.description: If damage reduces The Grey Knight to 0 hit points, they must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken. If the damage is radiant or from a critical hit, The Grey Knight automatically fails this saving throw. On a success, The Grey Knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

Bonemonger Phalange (Osteomancer).name: Bonemonger Phalange (Osteomancer)
Bonemonger Phalange (Osteomancer).description:
Little is known about astral hermits thanks to their propensity to set up shop in hard-to-reach locations. They are far-travelling aberrations, each developing extremely specific obsessions such as light, words, or bones. Astral hermits study their area of interest in meticulous detail, using it as a medium through which to learn more of the world.

Corporeal Forms. A male astral hermit is made up of two bodies: his heart and his hearth. An astral hermit’s hearth is a maze-like construction at the centre of which is a portal to the Astral Plane. The astral hermit’s heart is how he presents himself to the world. Usually, this is in a form that is inviting to creatures of that plane, a tactic which ensures plentiful trade.

Reproduction. Male and female astral hermits lead two very different existences. A male astral hermit’s hearth is his bower, and his heart can never travel further than a few hundred feet from it. The abundance and richness of its treasures (which to the common person may appear as worthless relics) help to impress females of the species, which flit through the Astral Plane searching for portals into the hearth’s of other hermits. When a union is formed, eggs are produced and jettisoned into the astral expanse.

Crafters and Enchanters. Astral hermits are innately magical beings, able to imbue items or creatures with enchantments shaped by their subject of obsession. Unable to travel far from their hearths, astral hermits create reputations of skill with enchanting and use that as the currency with which they trade for relics that further fuel their obsession.

Bonemonger. The bonemonger’s obsession is bones. Fossilised, inscribed, splintered, or fresh, the bonemonger can read the history of every bone that passes him, learning much of the creatures to which they once belonged. The bonemonger has also learnt to animate these bones with his necromantic magic, allowing them to act as guards, workers, and scouts. The bonemonger chooses the form of a tiny white rabbit as his heart, an unassuming form that is nevertheless extremely deadly when threatened.

Go For The Throat.name: Go For The Throat
Go For The Throat.description: The bonemonger deals an extra 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) damage when it hits a target with a bite attack and has advantage on the attack roll.

Insightful Telepathy.name: Insightful Telepathy
Insightful Telepathy.description:
The bonemonger is constantly under the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{detect thoughts} spell (save DC 13). As a bonus action, it can probe deeper into the mind of any creature it can detect in its lair. If the creature fails its saving throw, the bonemonger has advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the start of the bonemonger’s next turn.

The bonemonger uses insightful telepathy, make a Wisdom saving throw!

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the bonemonger fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.name: Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or Long Rest)
Osteomancer (Recharges After A Short Or.description:
If the bonemonger would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 88 hit points, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bonemonger can now use the option in the “Mythic Actions” section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional [[/award 1800xp]] (2,900 XP total) for defeating the bonemonger after its Osteomancer activates.

The bonemonger uses osteomancer.

Mythic Actions.name: Mythic Actions
Mythic Actions.description:
If the bonemonger’s Osetomancer trait has activated in the last hour, it can use the option below as a legendary action.

[[/item RsCFedyWEJ1wY6ab]]{Bonetide (Costs 2 Actions)}. A wave of animated bones ripples out from the bonemonger in either a 60-foot cone or 20-foot-radius sphere (bonemonger’s choice). Each other creature in the area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) slashing damage and being knocked &reference[prone] on a failure, or taking half as much damage and not being knocked prone on a success.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The bonemonger makes one Bite attack and uses Mi.

Legendary Actions.name: Legendary Actions
Legendary Actions.description:
The bonemonger on can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The bonemonger regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.
